name: Mick Harris
description: '''Michael John Harris''' (born 4 October 1967) is an English musician from [[Birmingham]]. He was the drummer for [[Napalm Death]] between 1985 and 1991, and is credited for coining the term "[[grindcore]]". After Napalm Death, Harris joined [[Painkiller (band)|Painkiller]] with [[John Zorn]] and [[Bill Laswell]]. Since the mid-1990s, Harris has worked primarily in [[electronic music|electronic]] and [[ambient music]], his main projects being [[Scorn (band)|Scorn]] and [[Lull (band)|Lull]]. He has also collaborated with musicians including [[James Plotkin]] and [[Extreme Noise Terror]]. According to [[AllMusic]], Harris's "genre-spanning activities have done much to jar the minds, expectations, and record collections of audiences previously kept aggressively opposed."
